medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 days prior to presentation, characterized by abdominal pain, particularly worse in the RUQ, and nausea with non-bilious non-bloody emesis. Patient has been unable to tolerate oral intake during this time. Pain reported ongoing upon arrival at the floor, with some transient radiation to the left shoulder that improved with repositioning.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of esophageal cancer post-resection and chemoradiation, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, chronic back pain, gastric AVM status post-coagulation, anemia, vitamin B12 deficiency, psoriasis, morbid obesity, hypercholesterolemia, and dilated aortic root.
medical_history.family_history: Denies family history of colon cancer or gastrointestinal malignancy. Brother has thyroid cancer, sister has lymphoma, and other sisters have breast cancer.
